G4987-d-04-24-01-WC.Contributing Accident Cause: Motor car or on-track equipment rules, failure to comply
G4987-d-04-24-01-WC.Accident Cause: Train order, track warrant, track bulletin, or timetable authority, failure to comply
G4987-d-04-24-01-WC.Narrative: THE TRAIN WAS JUST GOING INTO A CURVE AT MILEPOST 217 WHEN THE ENGINEER SPOTTED A MAINTENANCE EMPLOYEE RUNNING AWAY FROM THE TRACKS.  AS HE LOOKED AHEAD, HE SAW THE BRANDT TRUCK AROUND THE CURVE ON THE TRACKS.  THE ENGINEER PUT HIS TRAIN INTO EMERGENCY AND BOTH CREW  MEMBERS BRACED FOR THE IMPACT.INVESTIGATION INTO THE INCIDENT FOUND THAT THE CREW ON THE BRANDT TRUCK HAD MISREAD THE TRACK CHARTAND WERE OPERATING BEYOND THEIR TRACK WARRANT.  THE OPERATOR HAD PROCEEDED SOUTH OUT OF HIS LIMITS INSTEAD OF NORTH AS HE WAS SUPPOSE TO.  BOTH CREW MEMBERS ON THE BRANDT TRUCK REALIZED THEY WERE HEADED IN THE WRONG DIRECTION AND WERE SLOWING THEIR TRUCK WHEN THEY SAW FL093 COMING AROUND THE CURVE.BOTH MEMBERS JUMPED OFF THE BRANDT TRUCK BEFORE IT WAS STOPPED OR THE IMPACT TOOK PLACE.  TESTING WAS DONE ON BOTH EMPLOYEES ON THE BRANDT TRUCK AND ALL RESULTS WERE NEGATIVE.  THE BRANDT TRUCK WAS DESTROYED AND THE DV IS GIVEN.  ONE OF THE FIVE CARS BEING PULLED BY THE BRANDT TRUCK  WAS ALSO DERAILED.  THE ENGINE ON FL093 DID NOT DERAIL BUT WAS DAMAGED IN THE IMPACT.  THE ENGINEER ON TRAIN FL093DID SEEK CHIROPRACTIC TREATMENT  FOR LOW BACK STRAIN SUFFERED IN THE IMPACT.NoneNoneNone

THEY RETURNED TO TRACK NO. 8, COUPLED ONTO CARS AND BEGAN PULLING OUT OF NO. 8 TRACK WHEN THE TWO UNATTENDED CARS ON TRACK 6 ROLLED BACK OUT AND CONTACTED CARS IN PULL RESULTING IN THE DERAILMENT AND EXTENSIVE DAMAGE TO ONE CAR AND DAMAGE TO FIVE OTHER CARS.  UHR TESTING PERFORMED ON CREW MEMBERS. DUTY OFFICER ARRIVED ON SITE TO NVESTIGATE AND INTERVIEW CREW, HULCHER ORDERED TO SITE FOR RERAILING AND MSO DISPATCHED TO SCENE FOR INSPECTION OF CARS.    CONTRIBUTING FACTOR #1:   FAILURE TO INSURE CARS SWITCHED TO TRACK 6 COUPLED TO STANDING CARS SECURED WITH HAND BRAKES TO ANCHOR CAR BEING SWITCHEDTO THEM.  RECOMMENDED CORRECTIVE ACTION:  CREW MEMBERS INVOLVED TO DISCUSS WITH 10 DIFFERENT EMPLOYEES THE INCIDENT AND HOW TO AVOID IT HAPPENING TO THEM.NoneNoneNoneNoneNone

EQ20010404-d-04-21-01-LI.Primary Accident Cause: Use of switches, other (Provide detailed description in narrative)
EQ20010404-d-04-21-01-LI.Accident Cause: Use of switches, other (Provide detailed description in narrative)
EQ20010404-d-04-21-01-LI.Narrative: THE YE-19 YARD CREW COPULED 2 MU CARS TO A SIX CAR CONSIST ON TRANSFER "B" YARD TRACK AT HILLSIDE YARD IN QUEENS.  THE HITCH WAS MADE DIRECTLY OVER AN AUTOMATIC SAFETY SWITCH THAT WAS NOT PROPERLY LINED FOR A WESTWARD MOVEMENT.  WHEN THE COUPLED CONSIST (TOTAL OF 8 MU CARS) WAS MOVED WESTWARD THE TRAIN CONSIST TOOK TWO DIFFERENT ROUTES RESULTING IN THE DERAILMENT OF MU CAR 9608 AND DAMAGE TO EQUIPMENT AND PROPERTY.  NO INJURIES WERE REPORTED AS A RESULT OF THIS ACCIDENT.  THE CAUSE WAS DETERMINED TO BE THE CONDUCTOR'S FAILURE TO COMPLY WITH OPERATING RULE 104B WHICH REQUIRES THAT ALL WHEELS OFAN ENGINE OR CAR MUST PASS THROUGH AN AUTOMATIC SAFETY SWITCH OR THE SWITCH POINTS MUST BE PROPERLYPOSITIONED BY HAND BEFORE ANY REVERSE MOVEMENT IS MADE.  FRA CAUSE CODE H799- USE OF SWITCHES, OTHER.  HUMAN FACTOR ACCIDENT.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

2001040315-d-04-03-01-MNCW.Narrative: 1868 WAS INSTRUCTED TO PUT THEIR EQUIPMENT AWAY ON TRACK 6 NORTH.  THEY PROCEEDED NORTH ON TRACK 8 AND THE FIRST SWITCH (6/8) WAS LINED FOR THE MOVE.  THE 2ND SWITCH (6 YARD LEAD ) WAS LINED AGAINST THEM.  THE ENGINEER THREW THE SWITCH FOR THE DIRECTION OF THE MOVE.  THE CONDUCTOR TESTED THE DUMP VALVE.  BOTH ENGINES AND THE NORTH 5 1/2 CARS TRAVERSED THE SWITCH TRAVELING NORTHBOUND WITHOUT INCIDENT.  THE CONDUCTOR STOPPED THE TRAIN WHEN IT CLEARED THE 6/8 SWITCH.  THE CONDUCTOR DETRAINED, THREWTHE SWITCH FOR TRACK 6, BOARDED THE TRAIN AND INSTRUCTED THE ENGINEER TO PROCEED SOUTH.  THE CONDUCTOR STATED HE FELT WHAT WAS LIKE WHEEL SLIP AND INSTRUCTED THE ENGINEER TO STOP.  THE FOLLOWING CARSDERAILED:  NORTH TRUCK CAR 6188, BOTH TRUCKS CAR 6278, NORTH TRUCK CAR 6254, NORTH TRUCK CAR 6268.;NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

ID01185-d-04-09-01-NECR.Narrative: TRAIN 323 WITH 3 ENGINE, 21 LOADS 62 EMPTIES WAS NORTHBOUND MOVING AT 38 MPH IN CTC TERRITORY ON JOINTED RAIL.  TRAIN WAS NEGOTIATING A 2 DERGEE LEFT HAND CURVE AT MILE 139.5 AND ENCOUNTERED A SECTIONOF TRACK THAT WAS COVERED WITH SILT AND GRAVEL THAT HAD WASHED DOWN OVER THE BANK FROM ABOVE.  THELEAD ENGINE SUCCESSFULLY NEGOTIATED THROUGH THE OBSTRUCTION WITHOUT DERAILING.  THE SUBSEQUENT 2 TRAILING LOCOMOTIVES, 9 LOADED SALT HOPPERS, 2 EMPTY BOXCARS, AND 1 EMPTY LIME SLURRY CAR DERAILED ANDCASCADED DOWN THE EMBANKMENT COMING TO REST ON THE RIVER BANK ON THE EAST SIDE OF THE MAIN TRACK.  THE EQUIPMENT CAME TO REST WITH THE 1ST TRAILING LOCOMOTIVE, (THE NECR 5033), LYING ON THE ENGINEERSSIDE AND THE 2ND , (NECR 3846), WAS STANDING IN THE RIVER IN 8 FEET OF WATER PERPENDICULAR TO THE TRACK .  APPROXIMATELY 400 FEET OF TRACK WAS TORN UP.  THERE WERE NO PERSONAL INJURIES AS A RESULT OFTHIS DERAILMENT.NoneNoneNoneNoneNone

ID01228-d-04-27-01-NECR.Narrative: TRAIN 324 WITH 3 ENGINES, 56 LOADS AND 6 EMPTIES WAS SOUTHBOUND MOVING AT 20 MPH IN TWC TERRITORY ONJOINTED RAIL.  THE MAXIMUM AUTHORIZED SPEED WAS 40 MPH AND THE TRAIN HAD JUST PASSED THROUGH A 25 MPH SPEED RESTRICTION.  THE TRAIN WAS NEGOTIATING A 4 DEGREE LEFT HAND CURVE AT MILE 114 OF THE ROXBURY SUBDIVISION WHEN A WHEEL ON THE HIGH SIDE OF THE CURVE CLIMBED THE RAIL AND DERAILED ONE SET OF TRUCKS.  THE CAR TRAVELED FOR APPROXIMATELY 40 CAR LENGTHS BEFORE KNOCKING THE GAGE OF THE RAIL OUT CAUSING A TOTAL OF 7 CARS TO DERAIL INCLUDING 5 LOADS AND 2 EMPTIES, WHICH WERE CARS 13-19 IN THE CONSIST.  THERE WERE NO INJURIES RESULTING FROM THIS INCIDENT AND NO HAZARDOUS MATERIALS WERE INVOLVEDEITHER.  QUESTIONS 31A, B, AND C:  THE PRINCIPLE CAR DERAILING REMAINS TO BE UNDETERMINED.  18TH CARIN THE CONSIST IS SUSPECTED TO BE THE FIRST TO DERAIL, HOWEVER THERE WAS NO CONCRETE EVIDENCE.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

BA0418011-d-04-18-01-BAR.Narrative: NO 204 WAS IN SIDING AT PACKARD WAITING FOR A SOUTHBOUND FREIGHT. THE CREW ATTEMPTED TO EXTINGUISH THE FIRE WITH FIRE EXTINGUSHERS, CUT POWER FROM TRAIN AND PROCEDED NORTH TO MEET THE FIRE DEPT AT WEST SEBOOIS.  THE FIRE WAS EXTINGUSHED BY THE MILLINOCKET FIRE DEPT AT WEST SEBOOIS.  THE HEAT FROM THE FIRE MELTED A SITE GLASS RUBBER HOSE ON THE FUEL TANK AND CAUSED ABOUT 70 GALS.
